en: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
hmr: Jerusalema lal, David naupa Thuhriltu thuhai chu:

en: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher; vanity of vanities, all is vanity.
hmr: “Teplohai teplo, Thuhriltu chun, teplohai teplo! Thil po po hi teplo a nih,” a ta.

en: What profit hath man of all his labor wherein he laboreth under the sun?
hmr: Miin a sininrimna, nisa hnuoia a sininrimna po poa chun ieng am hlâwkna a hmu a?

en: One generation goeth, and another generation cometh; but the earth abideth for ever.
hmr: Suon khat a fe liem a, suon dang a hung suok a; Leihnuoi ruok hi chu a um ngaiin a um zing a.

en: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to its place where it ariseth.
hmr: Nisa chu a hung suok a, nisa chu a tla nâwk a, A hung suokna hmun ma chu a tlung nâwk vak a.

en: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it turneth about continually in its course, and the wind returneth again to its circuits.
hmr: Thli chu simtieng a hrâng a, hmartieng a kîr nâwk a. A vêl a vêlin thli chu a hrâng a, Chu thli chu a fe kuolnaa bawk chun a kîr nâwk a.

en: All the rivers run into the sea, yet the sea is not full; unto the place whither the rivers go, thither they go again.
hmr: Vadunghai po po chu tuisuorietah an luong lût a, Anachu tuisuoriet chu a sip nawh a: Vadunghai chu an hung suokna hmun tiengah, chutieng ma chun an kîr nâwk a.

en: All things are full of weariness; man cannot utter it: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.
hmr: Thil po po hi inrimna el a nih; miin a hril thei nawh; A hmua hmuin mit chu a tlai ngai nawh a, A hrieta hrietin na khawm chu a sip ngai bawk nawh.

en: That which hath been is that which shall be; and that which hath been done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.
hmr: Thil ni tasa kha, thil la hung ni ding chu a na; Thaw tasa kha la thaw ding chu a nih: Nisa hnuoia hin thil tharlâm hrim a um nawh.

en: Is there a thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it hath been long ago, in the ages which were before us.
hmr: Miin, “En ta, hi hi a thar a nih” an ti ding thil hrim a um am a nih? Einihai hmaa lo um ta dai ruok an nih;

en: There is no remembrance of the former generations; neither shall there be any remembrance of the latter generations that are to come, among those that shall come after.
hmr: Hi hma thilhai hriet zingna a um nawh a, La hung um ding thilhai khawm chu Suon hung um dinghai laia tukhawmin hre zing chuong naw nih.

en: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
hmr: Kei Thuhriltu hi Jerusalema Israelhai chunga lal ka ni tah a.

en: And I applied my heart to seek and to search out by wisdom concerning all that is done under heaven: it is a sore travail that God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised therewith.
hmr: Vânkhuphnuoia thil thawa um ta po po chungthu chu varnaa zawnga zawng suok dingin ka lungril ka lo hmang tah a; Pathienin mihriem nauhai buoipui dinga a pêk chu sin rinumtak a nih.

en: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all is vanity and a striving after wind.
hmr: Nisa hnuoia sin thawa um tahai po po chu ka hmu tah a; chun, ngai ta, thil po po chu teplo el, lungril sâwlna el a nih.

en: That which is crooked cannot be made straight; and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.
hmr: A kâwi ta hlak chu siem tlûn thei a ni nawh a, Chun, a um naw hlak tiem el thei a ni hliek nawh a.

en: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I have gotten me great wisdom above all that were before me in Jerusalem; yea, my heart hath had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
hmr: Ka lungrilin, “Ka hmaa Jerusa- lema umhai po po nêkin varna ka nei nasa lem a nih, ka lungril khawmin hrietthiemna le varna nasatak a nei a,” ka tih a.

en: And I applied my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also was a striving after wind.
hmr: Chun, intlâwkna le invêtna hre dingin le, varna chu hre dingin ka lungril ka sêng a; hi khawm hi nuom- hmanglo el a niin ka hriet tah a.

en: For in much wisdom is much grief; and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.
hmr: Varna tamtak umnaa chun lungngaina tamtak a um veh a; Hrietna insukpungtu khawm chun lungngaina ân sukpung bawk a nih.
